message.content:
I'd be happy to help you with a healthy meal plan that accommodates your dietary restrictions.

Here's a 7-day meal plan for you, taking into account the foods you need to avoid:

**Monday**

* Breakfast: Berry Oat Bowl - Cook steel-cut oats with water and top with mixed berries (such as blueberries, strawberries, raspberries), sliced banana, and a sprinkle of chia seeds.
* Lunch: Grilled Chicken Salad - Grilled chicken breast served on a bed of mixed greens with cherry tomatoes, cucumber slices, and a citrus vinaigrette dressing made with lemon juice and olive oil.
* Dinner: Quinoa and Vegetable Stir-Fry - Cook quinoa and stir-fry with sliced bell peppers, carrots, broccoli, and your choice of protein (such as tofu or chicken breast). Season with salt, pepper, and a drizzle of sesame oil.

**Tuesday**

* Breakfast: Avocado Toast - Whole grain toast topped with mashed avocado, sliced tomato, and a sprinkle of salt.
* Lunch: Lentil Soup - Cook lentils with vegetables (such as carrots, celery, and onions) and season with cumin, paprika, and salt. Serve with a side of mixed greens salad with vinaigrette dressing.
* Dinner: Baked Salmon with Roasted Vegetables - Season salmon fillet with salt, pepper, and lemon juice, and bake in the oven with sliced sweet potatoes and Brussels sprouts.

**Wednesday**

* Breakfast: Smoothie Bowl - Blend together frozen berries, banana, spinach, and coconut water. Top with sliced fruit and a sprinkle of chia seeds.
* Lunch: Grilled Turkey Wrap - Whole grain wrap filled with sliced grilled turkey breast, lettuce, tomato, cucumber, and avocado.
* Dinner: Vegetable Curry - Cook curry sauce with vegetables (such as cauliflower, bell peppers, and potatoes) and serve with brown rice or naan bread.

**Thursday**

* Breakfast: Coconut Oatmeal - Cook steel-cut oats with coconut milk and top with sliced banana and a sprinkle of cinnamon.
* Lunch: Chickpea Salad - Mix together cooked chickpeas, diced cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion. Season with lemon juice and olive oil.
* Dinner: Grilled Shrimp Skewers with Roasted Vegetables - Marinate shrimp in a mixture of lemon juice, salt, and pepper, then grill and serve with roasted vegetables (such as zucchini, bell peppers, and onions).

**Friday**

* Breakfast: Scrambled Eggs with Spinach and Tomatoes - Scramble eggs with fresh spinach and sliced tomatoes.
* Lunch: Quinoa and Black Bean Bowl - Cook quinoa and black beans with diced tomatoes and season with cumin and chili powder. Serve with a side of mixed greens salad.
* Dinner: Grilled Chicken Breast with Roasted Asparagus - Season chicken breast with salt, pepper, and lemon juice, then grill and serve with roasted asparagus.

**Saturday**

* Breakfast: Coconut Yogurt Alternative (made from coconut milk) topped with sliced banana and granola made from oats and seeds.
* Lunch: Turkey and Avocado Wrap - Whole grain wrap filled with sliced turkey breast, avocado, lettuce, tomato, and cucumber.
* Dinner: Vegetable Stir-Fry with Tofu - Cook stir-fry with tofu, mixed vegetables (such as broccoli, carrots, and bell peppers), and season with soy sauce and sesame oil.

**Sunday**

* Breakfast: Omelette with Vegetables - Whisk together eggs and cook into an omelette with diced vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms).
* Lunch: Chickpea and Quinoa Salad - Mix together cooked chickpeas, quinoa, diced cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion. Season with lemon juice and olive oil.
* Dinner: Baked Chicken Breast with Roasted Sweet Potatoes - Season chicken breast with salt, pepper, and lemon juice, then bake in the oven with sliced sweet potatoes.

Remember to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day!

This meal plan includes a variety of healthy foods and avoids the ingredients you mentioned. However, please note that if you have any other dietary restrictions or allergies, be sure to consult with a healthcare professional or registered dietitian for personalized advice.
